name: HAT-P-1
scenarioDescription:
The HAT-P-1 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HAT-P-1 is a star with 1.15 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.17 times its radius. It is located 520.90 light years away from the solar system.

HAT-P-1 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HAT-P-1 system


HAT-P-1 b

HAT-P-1 b was discovered by the HATNet observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HAT-P-1 b is 166.95000000000002 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HAT-P-1 b is 14.785 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HAT-P-1 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HAT-P-1, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by HATNet.
